p.codeblock: abstract open(url: string, startPos: number): number;
abstract open(url: string, startPos: number): number;
Future<void> open({required String url, required int startPos});
public abstract int Open(string url, Int64 startPos);

section.title: Timing
section.p: Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: Calling this method triggers the callback. After receiving the playback state report PlayerStateOpenCompleted, you can call the method to play the media file.
After calling this method, the callback is triggered. Once you receive the playback state PlayerStateOpenCompleted, you can call the method to play the media file.
After calling this method, the callback is triggered. When the playback state is reported as playerStateOpenCompleted, you can call the method to play the media file.
After calling this method, the callback is triggered. Once the playback state PLAYER_STATE_OPEN_COMPLETED is reported, you can call the method to play the media file.

plentry.pd: The path to the media file, supporting both local and online files.
The starting playback position in milliseconds. The default value is 0.
The path to the media file. Supports both local and online files.
The starting playback position in milliseconds. Default is 0.
Sets the path of the media file. Supports both local and online files.
Sets the start playback position in milliseconds. Default is 0.
The path to the media file. Supports both local and online files.
The start position (in milliseconds) for playback. Default is 0.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
